alert.note: Alert for Atoka (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 10 at 3:41AM CDT until June 11 at 2:38PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Clear Boggy Creek near Caney affecting Atoka County.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC005-102045- /O.CON.KOUN.FL.W.0012.000000T0000Z-220611T1938Z/ /CANO2.1.ER.220609T1300Z.220610T1200Z.220611T1338Z.NO/ 341 AM CDT Fri Jun 10 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Clear Boggy Creek near Caney. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Creek levels rise to slightly above bankfull stages in western Atoka County and the northeastern edge of Bryan County. High stages on small feeder streams result in even greater depths to mainstem bottomlands near their points of entry into Clear Boggy Creek. Only croplands... pastures... and some secondary rural roads are affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM CDT Friday the stage was 27.3 feet. - Forecast...The Clear Boggy Creek is expected to rise to a crest of 27.4 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
